00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements the Number class
00004 #
00005 package Parser::Number;
00006 use strict; no strict "refs";
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Item);
00008 
00009 $Parser::class->{Number} = 'Parser::Number';
00010 
00011 sub new {
00012   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00013   my $equation = shift; my $context = $equation->{context};
00014   my ($value,$ref) = @_;
00015   return $self->Item("Complex",$context)->new($equation,$value,$ref)
00016     if (ref($value) eq 'ARRAY');
00017   $value = $value->value while Value::isReal($value);
00018   my $num = bless {
00019     value => $value + 0, # format the value as a number, just in case
00020     value_string => $value, # for decimal checking, etc.
00021     type => $Value::Type{number}, isConstant => 1,
00022     ref => $ref, equation => $equation,
00023   }, $class;
00024   $num->weaken;
00025   my $x = $num->Package("Real")->make($context,$value);
00026   $num->{isOne}  = 1 if $x eq 1;
00027   $num->{isZero} = 1 if $value == 0;
00028   return $num;
00029 }
00030 
00031 #
00032 #  We know the answers to these, so no need to compute them
00033 #
00034 sub isComplex {0}
00035 sub isNumber {1}
00036 sub isRealNumber {1}
00037 
00038 #
00039 #  Return the value
00040 #
00041 sub eval {(shift)->{value}}
00042 
00043 #
00044 #  If the number is negative, factor it out and
00045 #    try using that in the reductions of the parent objects.
00046 #
00047 sub reduce {
00048   my $self = shift; my $context = $self->context;
00049   my $reduce = $context->{reduction};
00050   if ($reduce->{'-n'} && $self->{value} < 0) {
00051     $self->{value} = -($self->{value});
00052     $self = Parser::UOP::Neg($self);
00053     $self->{op}{isOne} = 1 if $self->Package("Real")->make($context,$self->{op}{value}) eq 1;
00054   }
00055   return $self;
00056 }
00057 
00058 $Parser::reduce->{'-n'} = 1;
00059 
00060 
00061 #
00062 #  Call the Value::Real versions to format numbers
00063 #
00064 sub string {
00065   my $self = shift;
00066   $self->Package("Real")->make($self->context,$self->{value})->string($self->{equation},@_);
00067 }
00068 sub TeX {
00069   my $self = shift;
00070   $self->Package("Real")->make($self->context,$self->{value})->TeX($self->{equation},@_);
00071 }
00072 sub perl {
00073   my $self = shift; my $parens = shift;
00074   my $n = $self->{value};
00075   $n = '('.$n.')' if $parens && $n < 0;
00076   return $n;
00077 }

00081 sub NoDecimals {
00082   my $context = shift || Value->context;
00083   $context->flags->set(NumberCheck=>\&_NoDecimals);
00084 }
00085 
00086 sub _NoDecimals {
00087   my $self = shift;
00088   $self->Error("You are not allowed to type decimal numbers in this problem")
00089     unless $self->{value_string} =~ m/^[-+]?[0-9]+$/;
00090 }
